meanings.definition: In a way that cannot be avoided or prevented.
meanings.sent1: She knew she would inevitably have to face her fears.
meanings.sent2: The sun will rise inevitably every morning.
meanings.sent3: The cat's attempts to hide were inevitably futile.
meanings.sent4: Time marches on inevitably, regardless of our wishes.
meanings.sent5: The storm clouds gathered, signaling the inevitably approaching rain.

meanings.sent1: If you eat too much, you will inevitably feel sick.
meanings.sent2: Studying diligently will inevitably lead to good grades.
meanings.sent3: His love for ice cream inevitably resulted in a trip to the dentist.
meanings.sent4: The seeds planted in fertile soil inevitably grew into strong plants.
meanings.sent5: The detective's keen observation skills inevitably solved the mystery.
